cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is said to play a crucial role within the broader domain of nonverbal communication.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject has an important functional role or influence within the process, domain, or context represented by the object.
remarks: Captures inclusion/functional contribution relation rather than strict taxonomy.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is crucial in social interactions.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject has an important functional role or influence within the process, domain, or context represented by the object.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is important for interpersonal relationships.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject has an important functional role or influence within the process, domain, or context represented by the object.

args.justification: All three relations express that body language has an important functional role within a broader domain (nonverbal communication, social interactions, relationships). This is about contribution/role rather than a direct cause-effect chain, so a broad group emphasizing functional role/utility (FUNCTIONALITY) is more accurate than CAUSALITY.
args.remark: Relabeled from CAUSALITY to FUNCTIONALITY to better reflect that these edges describe the subject's functional contribution within the object domain rather than a strict causal mechanism.

executed_decisions.justification: All three relations express that body language has an important functional role within a broader domain (nonverbal communication, social interactions, relationships). This is about contribution/role rather than a direct cause-effect chain, so a broad group emphasizing functional role/utility (FUNCTIONALITY) is more accurate than CAUSALITY.
executed_decisions.remark: Relabeled from CAUSALITY to FUNCTIONALITY to better reflect that these edges describe the subject's functional contribution within the object domain rather than a strict causal mechanism.
